scenario:
fuboTV stock rose 11.5% on Thursday despite the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite indices being down 0.4%. The gain is attributed to strong television ratings for 2024, particularly in sports content, which is a key component of fuboTV's service offerings. Sports programming posted another strong year, with the NBA and NFL experiencing year-over-year growth. The NBA's viewership on ESPN platforms was up 5% year over year, while the NFL claimed 45 out of the 100 top-rated broadcasts last year.

fuboTV has been an early mover in the sports-focused streaming space, offering customers alternatives to traditional cable packages. The company's revenue increased 21% year over year to $377 million in the last quarter. However, the stock has been poor lately, down 56% over the last year due to competition from resource-rich companies like Amazon and Netflix. fuboTV has guided for sales between $426 million and $446 million for the fourth quarter, representing annual growth of 9% year over year at the midpoint. The company may need to significantly outperform its Q4 target to extend its bullish streak.
